jrobots.simulation

Class SimulationRun

  • java.lang.Object
    • jrobots.simulation.SimulationRun
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class SimulationRun
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A SimulationRun is basically a sequence of SimulationStates, but should rather be seen as a database with routines for manipulation. Thus, it is some kind of "simulation service".

    Listed functions:

    • Storing and loading SimulationRuns to disc
    See Also:

      • anonymizedClone

        public SimulationRun anonymizedClone()
                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                     java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Also called zombification.

        Does a full copy of this SimulationRun. Exchanges all Pilot implementations with PilotZombies.
        All internal data is stripped off from the pilots.

        Take them their thoughts but leave their decisions.

        That has the following effects:

        • The replay has smaller size, as data is omitted.
        • You no longer need the concrete Pilot implementation to see the replay.
        • The resulting replay can be given away freely without the risk of pilot decompilation.
        Returns:
        a lossy but functional copy of this SimulationRun
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Any exception thrown by the underlying OutputStream.
        NotSerializableException - Some object to be serialized does not implement the java.io.Serializable interface.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Something is wrong with a class used by serialization.
